jobDescription: About The Position We are looking for a motivated and scrappy Inventory and Back-of-House Associate with a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude to manage the back-of-house operations of our newest pop-up store. This role is equivalent to managing a small-scale warehouse. You like to take initiative and work behind the scenes to ensure smooth store operations. You have a knack for organizing and have experience loading and unloading inventory. You understand that the function of the back-of-house of a retail space is a small-scale warehouse. You will be a part of the Chicago pop-up team and help bring the local Glossier experience to life.  Full-time or part-time  Start date: August 2018  Duration: 2 months In place of a cover letter, in 500 words or less, please describe your inventory management experience and how it will bring value to a growing team in a brand new retail space.Responsibilities and Duties:InventoryHands-on work that will require handling of boxes, dollies, and transferring inventory between locationsReceive daily inventory shipments according to Glossier's operating proceduresCount, record, organize and unpack inventoryEnsure back-of-house/inventory room is organized and stocked at all timesMaintain inventory levels for products, cleaning supplies and non-consumablesConduct weekly inventory counts and audits and submit weekly reports to management and planning teamsMaintenanceMaintain the cleanliness and organization of back-of-house locationsAssist with setup of product placement and merchandise flow before and after store operating hoursSkills and Qualifications:Ability to lift 40 lb: you should expect to handle and range of package sizes and weights; some are large and lightweight and others are small and heavyA critical thinker who is able to excel and adapt in a fast-paced and ever-changing environmentPositive energy: you are a self-starter and love to take initiativeA roll-up-your-sleeves attitudeGreat communication skills: you can get along with everyone-patience is keyOrganization skills: you know the devil is in the detailsYou're passionate about the Glossier mission and understand the Glossier aesthetic and visual languageAble to work 4-5 days a week, including weekendsPrevious inventory and back-of-house experience is highly preferredExperience making operational improvements in a warehouse or inventory management environmentAble to work starting in mid-August, for about 2 monthsAbout Glossier Glossier is a beauty company that lives in NYC, is sold on the internet, and promotes a skincare-first philosophy that celebrates beauty in real life.
